trans-unit.source: Set up a video
trans-unit.target: Set up a video

trans-unit.source: Beginner Programmer Designer
trans-unit.target: Beginner Programmer Designer

trans-unit.source: !Note Stride supports most major video formats, but converts them to .mp4. To reduce compilation time, we recommend you use .mp4 files so Stride doesn't have to convert them.
trans-unit.target: !Note Stride supports most major video formats, but converts them to .mp4. To reduce compilation time, we recommend you use .mp4 files so Stride doesn't have to convert them.

trans-unit.source: !Note Currently, Stride doesn't support video on iOS platforms.
trans-unit.target: !Note Currently, Stride doesn't support video on iOS platforms.

trans-unit.source: 1. Add a video asset
trans-unit.target: 1. Add a video asset

trans-unit.source: Before you can use a video in your game, you need to import it as an asset.
trans-unit.target: Before you can use a video in your game, you need to import it as an asset.

trans-unit.source: Drag the video file from Explorer into the Asset View.
trans-unit.target: Drag the video file from Explorer into the Asset View.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, in the Asset View, click Add asset and select Media > Video, then browse to the video you want to add and click Open.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, in the Asset View, click Add asset and select Media > Video, then browse to the video you want to add and click Open.

trans-unit.source: Add video asset
trans-unit.target: Add video asset

trans-unit.source: If the video has audio tracks, you can import these at the same time, or import just the audio from the video.
trans-unit.target: If the video has audio tracks, you can import these at the same time, or import just the audio from the video.

trans-unit.source: Import video
trans-unit.target: Import video

trans-unit.source: Click OK.
trans-unit.target: Click OK.

trans-unit.source: Stride adds the video as an asset in the Asset View. If you imported audio tracks from the video file, Stride adds them as separate audio assets.
trans-unit.target: Stride adds the video as an asset in the Asset View. If you imported audio tracks from the video file, Stride adds them as separate audio assets.

trans-unit.source: Video and audio assets
trans-unit.target: Video and audio assets

trans-unit.source: !Note Currently, you can't preview videos in the Asset Preview.
trans-unit.target: !Note Currently, you can't preview videos in the Asset Preview.

trans-unit.source: For information about video asset properties, see Video properties.
trans-unit.target: For information about video asset properties, see Video properties.

trans-unit.source: 2. Add a video component
trans-unit.target: 2. Add a video component

trans-unit.source: In the Scene Editor, select or create an entity to add a video component to.
trans-unit.target: In the Scene Editor, select or create an entity to add a video component to.

trans-unit.source: !Tip It's usually simplest to add the component to the same entity that has the texture plays the video. This just makes it easier to organize your scene.
trans-unit.target: !Tip It's usually simplest to add the component to the same entity that has the texture plays the video. This just makes it easier to organize your scene.

trans-unit.source: In the Property Grid, click Add component and select Video.
trans-unit.target: In the Property Grid, click Add component and select Video.

trans-unit.source: Add video component
trans-unit.target: Add video component

trans-unit.source: Stride adds a video component to the entity.
trans-unit.target: Stride adds a video component to the entity.

trans-unit.source: Video component
trans-unit.target: Video component

trans-unit.source: In the Video properties, under Source, select the video asset.
trans-unit.target: In the Video properties, under Source, select the video asset.

trans-unit.source: Video source
trans-unit.target: Video source

trans-unit.source: Under Target, select the texture you want to display the video from.
trans-unit.target: Under Target, select the texture you want to display the video from.

trans-unit.source: Video target
trans-unit.target: Video target

trans-unit.source: Models that use this texture will display the video.
trans-unit.target: Models that use this texture will display the video.

trans-unit.source: When the video isn't playing in your scene, Stride displays the texture instead.
trans-unit.target: When the video isn't playing in your scene, Stride displays the texture instead.

trans-unit.source: 3. Create a script to play the video
trans-unit.target: 3. Create a script to play the video

trans-unit.source: After you set up the video component, play it from a script using:
trans-unit.target: After you set up the video component, play it from a script using:

trans-unit.source: myVideoComponent.Instance.Play();
trans-unit.target: myVideoComponent.Instance.Play();

trans-unit.source: Other functions
trans-unit.target: Other functions

trans-unit.source: LoopRange: The looping range (must be an area in the video in PlayRange)
trans-unit.target: LoopRange: The looping range (must be an area in the video in PlayRange)

trans-unit.source: IsLooping: Loop the video loop infinitely
trans-unit.target: IsLooping: Loop the video loop infinitely

trans-unit.source: SpeedFactor: Set the video play speed. 1 is normal speed.
trans-unit.target: SpeedFactor: Set the video play speed. 1 is normal speed.

trans-unit.source: PlayState: The current video play state (playing, paused or stopped)
trans-unit.target: PlayState: The current video play state (playing, paused or stopped)

trans-unit.source: Duration: The duration of the video
trans-unit.target: Duration: The duration of the video

trans-unit.source: CurrentTime: The current play time in the video
trans-unit.target: CurrentTime: The current play time in the video

trans-unit.source: Volume: The audio volume
trans-unit.target: Volume: The audio volume

trans-unit.source: PlayRange: The video start and end time
trans-unit.target: PlayRange: The video start and end time

trans-unit.source: Play/Pause/Stop: Play, pause, or stop the video
trans-unit.target: Play/Pause/Stop: Play, pause, or stop the video

trans-unit.source: Seek: Seek to a given time
trans-unit.target: Seek: Seek to a given time

trans-unit.source: Example script
trans-unit.target: Example script

trans-unit.source: 4. Add the script to the entity
trans-unit.target: 4. Add the script to the entity

trans-unit.source: In the Scene Editor, select the entity that has the video component.
trans-unit.target: In the Scene Editor, select the entity that has the video component.

trans-unit.source: In the Property Grid, click Add component and select the video script.
trans-unit.target: In the Property Grid, click Add component and select the video script.

trans-unit.source: My video script
trans-unit.target: My video script

trans-unit.source: Stride adds the script as a component.
trans-unit.target: Stride adds the script as a component.

trans-unit.source: You can adjust public variables you define in the script in the Property Grid under the script component properties.
trans-unit.target: You can adjust public variables you define in the script in the Property Grid under the script component properties.

trans-unit.source: Properties
trans-unit.target: Properties

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also
